content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is quite unique

I don't think there's a need to mention the extra layer of multiple towns repeatedly, it might be confusing given that the clash will only end up focusing on 1 town and its houses.

I suggest slightly rewording it to perhaps mention a single town. Particularly this part "Every house in each town [...] Each house gives out [...]", at first glance it sounds a bit non-intuitive when reading it fast. Not a big deal, just mentioning this for clarity.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I love candy

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Unique implementation of  Arithmetic Progressions.

Goal
* Please format "A" and "D" as [[variables]] and delete the quotation marks.

Input
* Please delete "Given:".

* Please delete the last sentence.

* Please change all three descriptions so that they follow this format:

<<Line 1>>: An integer [[H]] for the number of houses

Constraints
* Please delete all constraints, and rewrite as follows:

[[H]], [[A]] ≥ 0
-10 ≤ [[D]] ≤ 1000

Cases
* Please rearrange / revise the cases such that each test is similar to its corresponding validator. For example, as [[D]] = 0 in Test 1, [[D]] should also be 0 in Validator 1. Similar principles for all other pairs of cases; each pair should feature a particular scenario.

Thanks.
Thank you for the review and compliment.

Thank you for following up. There are still some issues:

Input
* Please add the line number and the variable type in front of each description for ALL three lines, e.g.

<<Line 1>>: An integer [[H]] - number of houses.

* Please delete "You need to calculate the total number of candies distributed in that town." This is not an input description.

Cases
* Each test should be SIMILAR to but NOT the same as its corresponding validator. Please revise the cases.

Thanks again.
Hi, if you are satisfied with the contribution and there are no further issues, could you kindly approve it? Thank you!
I don't have further comments on the clash, but as I haven't coded my own working solution, I'm not in a position to approve it.
